Ingredients.4: 1 (6 ounce) package dry bread stuffing mix

Ingredients.7: 4 slices toasted white bread, torn into small pieces

Ingredients.8: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.2: Remove and discard giblets. Rinse turkey and pat dry with paper towels. Place turkey in a shallow roasting pan.

Directions.3: Bring water and 4 tablespoons butter to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in stuffing mix, cover, remove from the heat, and let rest for 5 minutes.

Directions.4: While stuffing is resting, melt remaining 1 tablespoon butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add celery and onion; cook and stir until tender, 5 to 7 minutes.

Directions.5: Add celery and onion to the stuffing. Mix in toasted bread pieces and season with salt and pepper.

Directions.6: Loosely scoop stuffing into the body and neck cavities of the turkey. Rub exterior of the turkey with vegetable oil and loosely cover with aluminum foil.

Directions.7: Roast turkey in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the thigh reaches 180 degrees F (85 degrees C) and the interior of the stuffing reaches 165 degrees F (70 degrees C), about 3 1/2 to 4 hours. Remove foil during the last 30 minutes of cooking to brown the bird.
